Erik,

I know this is off topic, but capturing an image of a website, I've  
sued various tools like thumbshots.org etc, but never found a really  
good solution that wasn't cobbled through "use x windows and special  
libraries and headless browser and X & W & Z tech"...   Do you know of  
any decent well supported open source solution out there?

I will say I think Heritrix gives a great base for building your own  
functionality, especially the more modularies H2 version.

Eric

On Apr 30, 2009, at 12:30 PM, Erik Hetzner wrote:

> At Thu, 30 Apr 2009 14:11:34 +0100,
> Rahil Baig wrote:
>>
>> Hi
>
>> I have installed and done initial very basic run of Heritrix, which
>> works fine. However im not sure if it is the right product that im
>> looking for. I don't have any experience with web crawlers at all,
>> and im fairly non-technical. Therefore hoping any of you could help
>> me. I am wondering if Heritrix supports following features.
>>
>> - Manage user rights and security levels
>
> Heritrix supports password authentication for the administrative
> interface, this is the extent of authorization and authentication
> support.
>
>> - Schedule auto-crawl for jobs - for example, crawl a group of
>> websites at regular intervals in a given day
>
> No, but this is fairly trivial to do. You might also look at the Web
> Curator Tool [1], which does handle crawl scheduling (along with much
> more).
>
>> - Crawl password protected sites
>
> The FAQ [2] includes a response to this question. Unfortunately a more
> detailed response depends on the type of authentication that the site
> uses.
>
>> - Indexing and keyword search on crawl results
>
> No; see Nutchwax [3] for full-text search of crawls.
>
>> Is there any possibility that a web crawler could capture the image
>> of web pages or am I desiring too excessively.
>
> Heritrix does capture images, i.e. <img> embeds in web sites. If you
> are looking for something to generate a raster image from a website
> there are tools out there to do this.
>
> best,
> Erik Hetzner
>
> 1. <http://webcurator.sourceforge.net/>
> 2. <http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/FAQ>
> 3. <http://archive-access.sourceforge.net/projects/nutch/>
> ;; Erik Hetzner, California Digital Library
> ;; gnupg key id: 1024D/01DB07E3
